title: Single Sign-On with UCMDB
content:
Single Sign-On can be achieved by connecting UCMDB and suite IdM, it also works when there are multiple SMAX tenants and multiple UCMDB customers. 

If you have connected UCMDB and suite IdM as described in Associate Service Management tenants with UCMDB customers, you can enable Single Sign-On between SMAX and UCMDB by following these steps:

  1. To permit users to navigate to an external UD/UCMDB through UCMDB browser, add the UCMDB host domain as an authorized domain. To do this, navigate to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings and add the UCMDB host domain to the Authorized domains for navigation field. Examples:
    • If the hostname is myhost.example.com, add "example.com" as an authorized domain.
    • If the hostname is myhost.subdomain.example.com, add "subdomain.example.com" as an authorized domain.
    See Authorized domains for navigation for details.
  2. Go to the SACM homepage, click SACM configuration.
  3. Check the Enable UCMDB browser check box.
  4. Enter the UCMDB Browser URL of the corresponding UCMDB customer. The UCMDB Browser URL resembles https://<UCMDB_Server_Host>:<UCMDB_Server_Port>/ucmdb-browser. You don't need to specify the UCMDB customer ID, when a user tries to open the UCMDB Browser in Service Management, a corresponding customer ID will be automatically appended to the URL.
    Note: When you try to open the UCMDB Browser by entering the URL in a web browser, you must manually append the UCMDB customer ID to the URL if UD/UCMDB multi-customer is enabled. For example, https://<UCMDB_Server_Host>:<UCMDB_Server_Port>/ucmdb-browser?customerID=xxxxxxxxx.
  5. Click Save.

The following example gives you an idea of how SSO works between SMAX and UCMDB.

  • A Service Management tenant tenant2 and a UCMDB customer customer2 are connected through IdM, and SSO is enabled. 
  • You are a user in tenant2.
  • You log in to SMAX and go to the SACM module.
  • You open an Actual Service record named (DEMO)SharePoint-Sales whose owner is you. 
  • You click Explore. You're automatically logged in to customer 2 in the UCMDB Browser. The corresponding detail page opens and shows the (DEMO)SharePoint-Sales CI owned by you.
  • In Service Management,you open the UCMDB UI module and see the information available to you in the UCMDB Browser.
